I remember watching my grand maa cook the best meals in the kitchen or sometimes passing her best recipes to my mom which of course which learned from hers. I was 6 years old then and since then have seen my dadi and mom cook some of the best meals for us in the house. Cooking a meal is one of the most personal and intimate things you can do for someone. You're literally providing plated nourishment made with your own hands and creativity ‚Äî even if you're following a recipe, you picked the recipe and planned the meal, didn't you? 22 years since then and now one thing that hasn't change is with the love my mom still cooks for all of us in the family. The moment you sit down to share that meal with your loved ones, you realise there is one thing that bonds all of us together and that is home cooked food. And thanks to Cook Fresh for helping us repaying it back to our mom and our family. Even if you are not a professional cook, you still will love to cook with the Cook Fresh boxes. How well have they conceptualised the idea is brilliant in itself. You are given a recipe card along with the cut ingredients and that's how simple it is. No chopping, no sweating, no cutting and still producing a gourmet dish. ¬†  So you must be wondering how does Cook Fresh work. They basically deliver ready to cook meals at your doorstep, hygienically packed in exact quantities.   You will first have to choose a dish to order. They have 39 mind blowing recipes from Thai Green Papaya Salad to Chicken and Broccoli Stir Fry to Moist Chocolate Mug Cake to Spaghetti Bolognese. I can feel your mouth watering already. Anyways, once you are sure about the dish to order, you can add that to your cart. If you want your orders to be delivered the same day, you will have to place an order before 2 pm. You can for your order either pay online or there is an option of a COD too. Once that is done you are then handed over a box which is very neatly packed with the measured ingredients along with the recipes card. All of the ingredients are pre-portioned, chopped and labelled inside a biodegradable box, which is designed to keep the contents fresh. Once you are ready to cook, open the box and cook yourself a gourmet dish and be ready to surprise your loved ones. The special thing about a home cooked meal is the feeling of abundance it provides, everything you have and need is right in front of you and within arms' reach. That feeling of freedom is real, and you see it in the smiles of your guests after the meal begins. Bon App√©tit.  Citrus chicken Quinoa salad (Rs 389): Quinoa is well on its way to being dubbed super grain of the millennium. Quick-cooking quinoa is a nutritional powerhouse, packed with protein, iron, and fiber. It is also the foundation for a main-course salad. I am absolutely in love with this and for sure ordering this whenever I am in a mood to order a heart and healthy salad.  Greek Salad (Rs 339): Made with pieces of tomatoes, sliced cucumbers, onion, feta cheese, and olives, typically seasoned with salt and oregano, and dressed with olive oil. This is exactly what you are looking for to beat this summer heat. This tart and crispy salad complements a variety of entrees, from casseroles and meats to pasta and pizza.  Spaghetti Bolognese (Rs 389): My mom is still praising me for this in front of my relatives :-p. From fusillini to Gnocchi to Farfalle, pasta comes in different shapes and sizes but my favourite has always been spaghetti. I love the way one slurps it down the throat. A classic Bolognese sauce tastes great, no matter how simple. Once that depth of flavour start coming in the sauce is sure to be one of family's favourite.   Chicken Pad Thai (Rs 389): What happens when fish sauce, soy sauce, tamarind paste, beans sprouts, ginger, garlic comes in contact with each other, magic happens. Pad Thai is one of my favourite dish that I can have anytime of the day, anywhere in the world. Made from stir fried rice noodles with ingredients including egg, peanuts, onions and chicken. Mastering an easy recipe for pad Thai with chicken at home is the best culinary discovery that has happened to me. Special thanks to Cook Fresh for this.  Goan Paneer (Rs 299): One thing about Cook Fresh is that it gives you the freedom to experiment your kitchen. Goan style Paneer is a simple and tasty variation from the regular Punjabi style paneer dishes. Funny, when I first saw the recipe card with coconut milk in it because that has never been a part of our curries. The cuisine is highly influenced by the Hindu origin, but has high impact from the Portuguese with their colonization for about 400 hundred years. Spicy on the palate you will enumerate this dish into your kitchen today.  So what are you waiting for, Cook gourmet, healthy meals like a professional chef at home with Cook Fresh!  Happy eating :)

Best dish at that place is one and only chilli patato. ....i tried all the dishes here.......but others are not gud enough.....near to my home ....so whenever I feel hungry this is the only place for fast food for me....

Ankit Fast Food Corner  - A small outlet on the Palam Dabri Road which was started by a lad named Ishwar. The guy started out by serving just Omelettes and Boiled eggs on a cart, but years of determination and hard work later he was able to transform his cart into a shop. The quality that he used to provide in the Omelettes was quite appreciable and made him a household name over time throughout the Palam Area as Bahadur Ande Wala.   Seeing the market trends, he has adapted with time and has now started serving all sorts of chinese food as well alongwith his claim to fame, the Omelettes and the boiled eggs. And these introductions have been quite well received as well as you will not found the shop empty at any time in the evening. One can see quite a healthy number of regulars here in the evening indicating his loyal base.  I've been here countless number of times for his famous Omelettes and the boiled eggs but have recently acquired tasted for their Chili Potato as well, which are crispy and flavorful and the prices are not pocket sucking either. The owner is quite a nice guy and the staff is very helpful too.  Overall a must visit place.

This is a small samosa joint situated across palam railway station. Although they have a huge variety of samosa's to offer which are like the regular normal samosa to pasta samosa, noodle samosa, etc. But all of it is just about average. Nothing too great.

A Small Fast Food outlet situated in front of the Palam Railway Station;Vikram Ji Snacks is famous for the wide array of Samosas they offer; ranging from Simple Aaloo Samosa to Onion, Chowmein, Macaroni, Mix Veg, Chilly Paneer, Meetha, Malai Samosa and a lot lot more. And after witnessing resounding success with their Samosas, they have now started offering other items like Spring Rolls, Bread Pakodas etc as well.¬†  The outlet being just in front of the Railway Station addresses hundreds of passengers daily and because of their ever-increasing sale they have converted this small old fashioned shop into a New modular one. Barring few tables placed outside, the outlet has not much space to offer as the inner part of the shop is used entirely by the staff indulged in the preparation of the snacks due to which most people prefer the take away option.  Been there a number of times and have tried their Aloo, Chowmein, Macroni and Meetha Samosa, each and every one has a great and unique taste to it. The size of samosas is big as compared to what you get from the other shops and thus is quite filling. Prices are nominal too.  Overall a heaven for samosa lovers.

Janta Lassi - An outlet in Palam which has been serving Lassi for almost a decade now.  The shop is in front of the Railway Station and offers Lassi, Paneer and other normal dairy products. Getting inspired from the huge success of their next door neighbor "Vikram ji Snacks" they too have started selling Samosas, Bread Pakoda, Kachori, Tikki and Burgers now.   Been there a number of times. Initially the price of Lassi ranged from 10-15-20 rupees but ever since the shop got renovated, the owner have tripled up the prices and are now offering it at 30-45-60 rupees per glass. The Lassi comprises of a scoop of butter and some secret liquid stuff which lends to it an amazing flavor. The quantity is also good, so much so that if you drink a Medium/Large Glass of their Lassi, there will be no place left in your stomach to have anything else.   Overall a must try for Lassi lovers.

The only thing good about the dinner tonight was live music. The order taking process was bad, as if the steward was doing us a favour by taking our order. The service delivery was pathetic. Our soup and main course came together, and was kept on our table with main course dishes along side. We were supposed to gobble our soup up fast and the quality of hot and sour chicken soup was pathetic. The after taste of the soup was so bad with zero salt in it. We had to request for the sauces to go with our main course, which the gentleman serving us had forgotten. Just because it was just the two of us. We were being treated as if they were giving us free food. The main course dish that we had ordered was kung Pao chicken with chilli garlic noodles and both of them were tasteless. We were not really sure that the chicken dish was actually Kung pao or not. The service was pathetic and when we wanted to talk to the manager, we were guided to him ... he was one person who actually made us feel as if he was doing us a favour by just listening to us. If you are a couple and looking to eat good Chinese, then we would NOT recommend you to go Chopsticks.  Not recommended AT ALL

I am totally in love with this place and would love to visit again and again. The ambiance the service and off course food made me extremely happy. The crowd was nice too. The live music reminded me of 80's and 90's. We ordered two types of soups, wonton and mon chow. Both were delicious to core. An amazing experience. Would highly recommend to all. :)
This place is horrible!!i have not been there,one of my frend ordered food from here which we got in home!!very poor!!cant imagine so cheap test!!

This place remained my mess for daily food for about a year and I must say I was very satisfied with my experience here. They serve lunch and dinner for daily visitors and have a huge parcel system to as far as Munirka. It is by far the best mess/budget daily restaurant in the whole area of Katwaria Sarai. The food is unlimited and the servers are very prompt. Rs. 35 per plate is a bargain anyone would have and especially with the weekly paneer, chicken, poori sabzi and other fixed offerings they have on scheduled days. Not to mention they superb egg curry for just Rs. 5 extra.  The restaurant serves surprisingly tasty and fresh food, way better than the decent mess. I must confess I never expected them to be that good, at par with some of the best combinations of price and quality in different places that have lived. Pick anything on the menu and you wont be disappointed!  ----- 17 Nov, 2012 ----- It is a budget mess for daily food whic is okay.. not good not bad.. good value for money for students..  restaurant is better.. chicken is really good amazing by its standards..  not bad..   food 3/5 service 3/5 value 3.5/5

Visited this place in the evening. When you visit this part of Delhi , it is usually 2-3 degrees lower than the capital average temp. But somehow I seem to love this place because of the peace this place offers.  To beat the cold , we ordered a cup of tea... requested them to put ginger.. what an awesome tea.... for the food, we ordered, kadhai chicken, plain parantha, egg parantha and raita......  The food was really good. The chicken was fresh, soft and overall the gravy was not spicy. You get a complimentary plate of salad with the food. Its not a tiny plate but a big one.. that's why I decided to mention this in the review.¬†  The parathas were very soft and I highly recommend people visiting this place to try out paranthas... they have variety of them.. service was quite and the staff was nice.¬†  Its a roadside eatery so please do not keep very high expectations from the ambiance perspective.  Overall a good experience and I am sure to visit again.
This quaint little snack shop serves decent tea and bread toasts... The noodles are also decent... If you overlook the hygiene conditions, it's a decent place for a quick snack in between classes..

This is one of the Dhabas in Qutub Institutional area situated opposite to the Monastery. I have tasted Parashar's aaloo parantha, keema parantha and macaroni. Aaloo parantha served here tops the list. Served with nutralite, pickle and red and green chutney, Parashar's aaloo parantha generously stuffed with mashed potatoes and onions is enough to satiate your hungry tastebuds. Even the macaroni was quite yummy; however, did not like the keema parantha stuffing. Service is quite fast and the waiters are quite attentive. The place is infested with mosquitoes and that's something really annoying. This place is ideal for dining with friends and family in winters.
A definite value for money place, good vada paws, you can get a full stomach under Rs.100 that to in hygiene! Like the fact that the paw is air fried while re heating rather than fried again.
Its jus average place.you cant eat inside better you get packed and have in home!!guys who serve vada paav just unprofessional and illiterate!!vada pav tastes good but not like mumbai wala taste!!

Nice place to eat in katwaria sarai, there are 3-4 types of thaali here under veg and non veg categories. Apart from thaali you can also order foods from menu. I personally like daal fry and egg curry.
Ate thali, good service, average cleanliness, location is good, space is a bit small, only four tables for four. Overall, it's a place where you can have cheap foods.
Nice Food... Best for Daily Fooding..........Its Kinda awesome in non-veg............... Service is fast....................................
Its not hygenic,lack of cleaniness. Veg meal consists mainly potato vegetables. Tastes good,but not much options. Very economical....its not costly. 300 rupees is good amount for 2 people.
best quality food...................chakhna is best.....

After office hangovers are quite common in our day to day life & being a foodie only delightful lucious meals can just swipe away the hangovers. So recently ordered from DE PIZZA MAKERS for the first time. In frame had regular size -bbq pizza , spicy pizza, -chunky pizza each costing ‚Çπ 100 each. To be mentioned the food was quite lucious and appetizing. Though local meat was used the taste, texture , flavour and appearance were all up to the mark raising the bars really high for other restaurants. And above all the price was within modest range. So I would recommend De pizza over and over again to all.
Pizza very testy and good qoulity nice service Very .very good test thanks.da pizza makers and staff Pizza place oder rite very good pizza and very good test
Order delivered was exactly opposite of order placed. Food quality was very bad. Customer service worst ever. No accountability. And least professional...

Complete waste of money. Got the order after 2 hours that too was crap. I ordered a cheese Burst and what lacked in the pizza was cheese. Onions too were stale and smelled. 50% of the pizza was bread.

Well not a good infra,not good ambience,not good locality but food is best nd gives u exact local dhaba taste which is far better than any expensive big chain of restaurant.i had never tried this restaurant coz f crowd and infra,but i was wrong.at times we shud try such restaurants for getting the taste of real street food.Best part of this restaurant they serve tawa roti and home made food!! Highly recommended.get their take away service coz u cant sit there and eat coz f poor infra and heat!!
This one good when you want to eat special food but not in a lavish restaurant. The food is tasty. I normally eat here on weekends when I dont want to go out in proper restaurants.
Awesome superfast delivery with tasty food ! Amazing ! Delivered 15minutes before the specified time.. #HatsOff üëç Including the person who delivered the food
Very much less quantity. I ordered Full plate of Chicken and I got my order in a Quater Chicken packet.  Very much costly also. Try not to buy from this restaurant.
Found an insect in the food that was ordered for us by our company. Clearly this is a super unhygienic place. Please don't eat from here. Extremely unsanitary.
Nice preparation...taste is awesome .best food preparation in this area..no more oil..have been to here manytimes,always fresh items and amazing preparation

Bloody stupid people. I have already eaten food in this hotel. The wife of the hotel owner have no sense how to treat and talk to people. Instead she does partialty by providing food to Bengali people first. No matter how late or early they come. Also she tried to make other people uncomfortable by saying "DADA PEHLE BAITHA THA USKO KHANA PEHLE MILEGA AAP BAAD ME AAYE THE". After that incident I have never eaten food in this hotel.
The first dhaba you'll find situated in Qutub institutional area. I Ordered mix veg Maggi here, the vegetables weren't fresh and it had a weird smell. Plain masala Maggi comparatively was better.

Despite the fact that the area is some 4-5 kms from my house, I yet end up going to this area for its sheer energy even in the calmness around. The order was handled efficiently and piping hot food was server in a jiffy. Slightly on the oilier side when compared to the other adjacent joints, but when you get the taste  when you feel famished you don't really care.  Can however maintain the place slightly more cleaner too and that's where it loses out marginally.
Place is well located. Good food. Not a lot of space. Only four tables. Ideal place for a quick stop. Television is also available for entertainment
Food is good and price is reasonable. Specially there chicken items. Chilly chicken is a must try. We were 3 and it cost only 800 for all of us.
We ordered 6 different parathas n they all were tasteless n smelled like shit.. stuffing was not fresh at all.. but yeah they did send too many ketchup sachets
Service is slow n serve a little less but taste is good
Best place for riders as garry paaji is so friendly in nature & serve very tasty foods‚ù§Ô∏è Must try cheese omelette üòç
Awesome experience and nice taste. Smoothing environment. Must visit  this lane is full of restaurants but this is clean and taste feels mouth watering.

So this is a new outlet in the area which is already occupied by a lot of road side stalls, but I must say that it's better than many others. Visited this place for a quick evening snack. Ordered dry veg manchurian. It tasted a little desi and did not have that typical Chinese flavour, but it was good. Chicken soup was really good and was a lot, served in a big bowl. Staff was pretty cordial.
Amazing poha available from 4 AM. Wonderful place for breakfast. A saviour for students like us who look for healthy and cheap breakfast places in Delhi.

They are located in qutub industrial area only for home delivery. They have very balanced menu with them. The menu is very economical for all segment of food. They have a variety of combinations like for offices they have a dabba for office people at a very reasonable rate.   As we find a very tasty food stuff and very well cooked. It is very good for this location that this type of food station is running here and serving a good food here. Keep it up.
Compare to other restaurants , their quantity was less and they have not any packaging facility , just lifafa packets.

A humble place serving flavoursome biryani. I tried their muradabadi biryani which cost ‚Çπ100 . The biryani taste good and the chicken and korma gravy is well cooked and are in great portion. For more reviews follow me on instagram @_thefoodassignment #biryani #thefoodassignment
This place is serves average food. BT the cleanliness of cafe is good . Host is polite and humble . Value for money in some items . Easy to reach

My weekend in Delhi took me to the foodies hub for students located in Hauz Khas. It is ‚ÄòThe Hubbub Cafe‚Äô in Jia Sarai, Hauz Khas- its a place that has humongous students crowd in the vicinity and hence this place is their hub. The hubbub serves everything good from Chinese appetizers to Indian mains at so very reasonable price just worthy for a student to spend on for a good meal.  I had an amazing indulgement in some chinese and indian meals out there. Below are my indulgement : üîÜHot & Sour Veg Soup üîÜVeg Spring Roll üîÜAloo Jeera| Butter Roti| Dal Fry  To cut it short, this place should be called an adda or hub not only for students but for all age groups too. Its price is reasonable for a fab and tummy filling meal. An average spend on complete indian thali that you could spend here  is 100 bucks. I would totally recommend this pocket friendly place especially to the youth and students considering their pocket and value for money.

Good ambient environment for sitting, and worst food I could find in Delhi. They also use stale ingredients. Would not recommend to anyone. You can better try some nearby outlets, or visit SDA market.

Yesterday I went here with my friend for having some food. We order Chhole Chawal, Aloo Dum, Mix Veg, Dal Fry, Makhni Paneer. Lovely and hot food of this outlet which we tried. Yes !!!!!!!!!!! good quality also and presentation was so perfect. One thing was perfect and that was Makhni Paneer...
Very nice staff, not much varieties of cake are available. Not too costly. It is well located and you can easily spot it. And hey, you also get Ice cubes there!
Everytime favourite food delicious and nutritious healthy Try it ryt now
Please guys don't ordered biryani from Abdul muradabadi they always cheated with clients this thing happened with me 2nd time.
My favourite place to have biryani.... Love it
A polite staff, very neat and clean surroundings, The taste is refreshing There is no seating arrangement but the shop is attractive The best quality chicken meat is provided A must have!!!
Good shop for chicken and fishes They also sell burger and pizza and many more Good quality products and safe to eat The shopkeeper is also very friendly

Located in sector 8 market just opposite to mother dairy i tried  many things from here . This outlet is for take away.i tried chicken and veg burger , sandwiche's  . Chicken breast piece and many things.
Good place for quick bites like chicken burger and veg burgen and chicken tikka roll .the taste of these Two is always awesome but breast chicken was soo dry.it was not fully cooked

Really bad experience as 1st time i tried veg burger at rk puram branch and they served me expired burger as at the time of having it taste of awful , base was to soggy .....smelling and when i checked date it was expired   Really bad experience

Well reataurant is ok ok types.can try once.Offlate m trying rajma from all nearby restaurants and unfortunately i cudn find anyone who can match up with my expectation.but this place is better than other places who serving bad rajma.rajma was nice but again overspicy.I dont get one thing why they cant cook up normal authentic rajma.There should be difference between rajma and rajma masala. Well packaging was nice. Food-3.5/5 need lot of improvement Packaging-4/5

Guys this new startup offers a good variety of food with a fingerlicking taste. Chilly Chicken is yummy and quite different from other food joints i've tried.¬†  They also offer bulk food for parties and all with good prices. Its surely a must try !
Spicy is my thing ....right place for delicate cooked fine takeaway...delivery was shockingly quick, happy customer vdesi next time tandoori
Crispy chicken of this place is really amazing and its a must try..... The service is also good and the presentation is too good..!!!  Its a must try people..!!!!
really unhygienic food. had paranthas while price was decent but it was not healthy.

If you are on a budget you don't have that much money to spend in a fine dine restaurant you should go there and have your food they don't have a nice ambience and a nice menu but they do have the simple Indian food. Enjoy eating

I placed my order from here and observed few things which I would like to share- most of the time I have seen that the restaurants will always juggle between quality and quantity, but this place is exception the quality and quantity was balanced. The packing mechanism was little older and the food wasn't packaged in containers, but I can let that go because of the taste of the food and that there would be no chance of tampering with the food while it is on the way for delivery.  And I want to apologize to the people working there because of an human error (from a toddler) the rating given for the food was a tad low. I hope this would make my mistake right.

I ordered my lunch from here. Scrolling through the menu I ordered Tandoori Roti thali as it showed "Bestseller" but I was a bit disappointed, the Roti's were not properly baked and lassi was so yukk. I would just say whatever u offer at ur price please give justice to that.
I ordered 1kg Biryani but they delivered only half Kg and apparently Zomato can‚Äôt do anything about it

Quantity of food is very less...you provide very less food i ordered two half biryani n u send only one...n customer service number was also not responsive... totally disappointed...never gonna order again.....,........................................................................................!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I ordered two half kg biryani and I got only one half kg biryani and which Number you provide in this outlet is not working and unsatisfied service
Terrible service, mess up my orders many times, plus the quality is getting worse,not recommended, skip this and try some other place,waste.
The Best Outlet Which Located at RK Puram i Love Here's Rolls and Wraps, Any Time i am Hungary i choose this Outlet for order rolls or Wraps.
Be careful do not order pricey pizzas they don't add toppings that they claim on apps that they sell on.

Few Days Ago I Ordered Peri Peri Paneer Pizza From here,  Toppings was to Large and Pizza Was so tasty and Soft.  But i am Giving 4 star Because They Not Provide Sufficient Sauce and Packaging is Not Proper.

Being a pizza lover, I love ordering from this place. I am a big fan of their veg loaded pizza and picante pizza. base is perfectly baked and toppings are fresh. A lovely balance of tastes on the fine thin crust base.¬† Follow my food journey on instagram- teekhi_mircheee
very bad food. quality of kadai paneer was not good :(

Taste like shit. I can‚Äôt even imagine to finish this whole butter chicken. I don‚Äôt think this is butter chicken it is more of a tomato chicken.. Disappointed. I don‚Äôt think I will be ordering from Rapchik biryani.

Eat chicken biryani from here and u will feel like u r in heaven. Their speciality is biryani only. So they r good in biryani and dont expect that they will serve u others food items best in taste. Take korma curry with biryani. Their korma in super tasty. Their chicken is not regular boiled chicken , its marinated and cooked chicken. So u will feel like there is tandoorj chicken in biryani. The taste is awsome and value for money. 50rs/qtr, 100rs/ half (4 chicken pieces), 180rs/ full (6 chicken pieces) . If u buy 2 half biryani then u get total 8 chicken pieces for 200rs only. But u must try their chicken biryani and chicken korma. ITS AWSOME!!!

Worst food outlet ever. Ordered afgani chicken and butter chicken. Afgani was fill with bones n very less cream. Looks like a cheap meat. Butter chicken was pathetic. Cooked in shahi paneer gravey. The owner was even clue less and pointed that it's the same way cooked in every restaurant. Please save money order from Sindhi snacks.

The chicken tikka was fried instead of grill it had bad smell Then butter naan was not fresh it also had faul taste.. chicken malai tikka was all mashed.. the salad n 1 butter naan had human hairs..!!
Sindhi cuisine being very vast and extra varied one they don‚Äôt have the authentic Sindhi taste. The dishes are really very oily and the quality of ingredients and raw material was below average.

I tried butter chicken, butter naan along with chicken seekh roll. Everything was too delicious.The roll was spicy. Their delivery service is also good. They serve food at affordable price. You must try once.
Please guys don't order from sindhi snacks this restaurant was not accept any order if you order your payment was blocked & no any order be careful
packaging not done properly.
But,butter is not in a tandoori roti
Been here for the first time. And loved tandoori chicken.. Though the ambiance would give a mixed feeling but trust me the taste of tandoori chicken is comparable to headquarters CP!!

Murgh kefta was out of the world especially with the dip they provided with. Mutton haleem was fine although the required spices were less. Total disappointment was bhuna murgh biryani which was sweet in taste. It completely spoilt the idea of having biryani on Eid. Behrouz specialises in biryani and it is important they don‚Äôt make blunders like this one.
Best biryani in town
Ordered mutton biryani by my friend for himself & me just 30 min ago....There is no masala nor any mutton pieces in it...Pathetic

I had ordered through zomato and idk what happened but two of my orders were messed up. I had ordered 2 chicken rolls but they gave 2 paneer instead.¬† And the soya malai chaap I ordered just tasted so weird.  Since I had ordered 4 different rolls, they did not write on their covers for me to differentiate. Though their mutton seekh roll was good.
Horrible taste. I have eaten from this outlet twice. Uncooked mushroom. Wastage of money
I ordered three rolls; mutton seekh, chicken tikka and paneer bhurji. 5/5 on taste! The delivery was quick and the packing was effective, no messy business here.
I ordered a mutton roll. Wow just wow. It was so delicious that it for sure be became a favourite. I recommend it to all my friends and family all the time. Ah here I go craving it again

34 CL is honestly my favourite roll place. It's original, tasty and very easily available. With so many options to pick from both in vegetarian and non-vegetarian, it's hard not to fall for their rolls.
A good place for family dining. Ground floor sweethouse and first floor is restaurant, making it a perfect combo.The Shahi paneer is a speciality here.
It's a small take away outlet in r k puram sector 9 and chinese is famous from here specially momos and chowmin.chicken burger is also good.
It's a van and i ordered veg chowmien , manchurian and spring roll the taSte of these are awesome and manchurian is very famous. It's not that much costly.

Located just beside R.K.Puram sector 1 bus stop,this small joint has got some real potential.They just won't compromise on the hygeine,Ive tasted almost every dish.  Service Dishes are prepared swiftly with a hard street presentation and style.The owner seems to be a nice and helpful person.  Ambience Sadly, the location does play as a major drawback. There is no seating available, just a few small tables where one stands and eat.  Taste Spring rolls Soft texture,very well done vegetables with a good amount of moisture retained,but they can be too spicy sometimes.  Chilli potato I won't rate them as the best ones I ever had( they have the potential though) because the consistency in the taste is never maintained. They would sometimes be the best ever had category and other time they'll have a weirdly strong green chilli taste. Overall,you should try it yourself.  Noodles Just average, a hardcore street style chowmein with bombarding sharp spice just enough to kill my junk food craving. But as I said it overall would taste just fine and not to great.  Sauce Since all the items here taste like real street dishes ,the hot sauce just not touches that spicy point.It has a sharp vinegar taste which dominates your taste buds.They really need to work upon the taste of momo sauce.  Great food,but I prefer you try it for delivery and takeaway only.

The combo packages are deceptive... They provide less quantity however the food quality is alright.. I ordered Chili Chicken with noodles combo... and I swear there was more of Onion and 3 small pieces of chicken..and that was not even flesh..  the noodle was too less probably it will not even fill a kid tummy

Zomato is bloody fraud, the price in the menu from the restaurant and price here are different. Food not properly sealed and not this. absolutely shameful on part of zomato. Bread section price are totally different

The food from here is totally yummy and you better make loads of space for it in your tummy! The Bhindi Masala and Palak paneer are really delicious. The quality of the vegetables and spices is great. The food quantity is more than sufficient. The food is also affordably priced. Definitely worth repeating.
I had ordered Chicken Biryani. The taste was okay but the quantity was very less and was not at all worth the amount. But the restaurant is good you can try out some other dishes.
test is not good

Tried the north indian thali. For a night delivery, the food was not bad but might be little unhealthy. Also, I doubt the hygiene level. Thali costed me approx 200 rs. So anyone craving for North indian thali can try it!

Ordered- Butter chicken   Taste-4/5 Price-4/5 Packaging-3.5/5  The butter chicken was very good and actually even I didn‚Äôt expected that the dish would turn out to be so good from this place.  Butter chicken (worth a try)  The ambiance of the place is low but you can take away the food for home

Butter chicken is not like your usual sweet makhni gravy,  their butter chicken is  spicy and buttery full of taste and full dhaba style if you're  looking for a good desi butter chicken then you should go for this,  i always pack my order and eat at home with family.

A mini dhaba with good food. Whenever you walk around in the lanes of Munirka and wish to have good food this Dhaba is one of them. Serving ghar ka khana at reasonable rates. One can try Kosha Mangsho, Chicken curry and rice. Whatever you try here gives you proper taste. Rupa Aunty keeps her customers entertained with gossips so you will have a proper channel of entertainment with food. Next time when you don't feel like cooking or you wish to change your dhaba. Rupa Bengali Dhaba is recommended. Food- 4 Value for money- 4 Ambiance- Is small shop so (2)
Cheap,value for money,neat and raat food

It's a very small restaurant with limited seating. You may end up sharing seats as well. The whole vibe of the place is very welcoming.  The food is just fantastic especially the pakoras and filter coffee.  I talked to the owner. It's a common hangout place for cyclists especially on a weekend. There are some pics of the groups that frequent the place.  Would definitely recommend coming here

Want some tasty and pocket friendly south Indian khaana, toh aur kahi nahi jaana. Visit Mysore Cafe for some scrumptious food.  üî∏Mysore Pak, amazing sweet dish üî∏Idli, soft with coconut chutney and Sambhar was just perfect. üî∏Onion Masala Dosa, so crispy and filled with onion masala, and served with coconut chutney and Sambhar. üî∏Set Dosa, this was a new item for me which was just amazing. üî∏ Coffee and Tea were just the perfect beverages.  This cafe is very authentic and the ambience is very pleasing. Staff is very courteous.  Food-5/5 Service-5/5
Its a typically south indian food restaurant. All items are tasty and cost effective. Spl dosa and coffee are the best ‚òùÔ∏è   Mostly people working nearby will go there .

And here is a gem which serves  delicious south indian food and is not well known. Finally we visited this place and loved everything we ate. Upma was so full of flavours and was so different  then what we usually get at other restraunts just for ‚Çπ50. Then we had bombay dosa and what a delicay it was. Usually we do not like combination of cheese and dosa but they had incorporated cheese so well that we couldnt stop munching. The dosa was so heavily  filled .These two items are a must try.

Not sure about the entry process but now I have something to rely on even with a 50 rs note in my pocket .....Chicken for rs 48 and rice rs 15....Yes guys that's the price ....A veg meal around 40-50 bucks....Yes guys a real meal under rs 100....Don't judge the taste....Just fill it in...

For some one who has lived in that area ..its an old haunt...sundar sasta tikau is what u will describe it as...a good cuppa of tea and some paranthas with bhaji is what we had for breakfast..hot and piping!
not worth at all.better you can have bread and butter at home.
Great location. But the quality of food was not good. There was only thali available that costs just Rs 50/-. Even for that, there was no value for money. 100% chance of improvement.

It's such a pleasant surprise !!¬† Have been going to this place since my teens, have seen many caterers changed.  This time it has changed for the best. I had one of my best meals ever at this place. Be it Masala Dosa, Sysore dosa or simple idli-wada, each item was fresh, well prepared and tasty.  Can go there any number of times. Been there for breakfast, however there dinner and lunch menu looks equally exciting, with the endless array of north indian, south indian, chinese and non-veg dishes.  Great food, decently priced, clean, airy and open to all.  It is in south avenue in one of the MP quarters, ¬†opposite to the Safal depot (near 3 Murti Bhawan) Must visit place.
Excellent food.....Great service....... Friendly staff..... They really went out their way to accommodate...... Must try their Bhuna Murg And tandoori chicken !!!!!!!

Recently opened,astonishing taste,very calm ambiance,staff is very friendly,loved the area behind ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§≠‡§µ‡§®‡•§ please do try once. Both tandoor and gravy items are amazind.
Great butter chicken and makhan daal. I would suggest just sticking to these things as the biryani was disappointing. Delivery has always been within the time.

Very unhygenic ,Unhealthy and over spiced food. We had odered for a home delivery. First we got late delivery then it was wrong order. on calling again the person on the orherside had confirmed that it was wrong orde then he sent it but the total dinner time for us took almost 2.30 hours. Delivery was quick but the taste still need to improve..It was too flat.. Mushroom was flat but eatable..Little more work on tarse will work for u guys .I am a regular customer and this is th 3rd time I  find it same in tatse so thought of sharing..

I order a chicken paratha combo and tandoori chicken.. It was really nice and combo was completely worth having and even the tandoori chicken was great.....

I have been ordering food from here for years and can honestly say they are head and shoulders above all competitors in Delhi, not only in terms of cost but also quality. Aren't I glad that we decided to not eat at the other usual joint we go to for lunch?!EVERYTHING is just right here!Cost effective? YES!VFM? YESQuality? GREAT!Service? GREAT!Food? GREAT!We had the thalis for lunch: 2 chicken and a fish one. Every thing that came as part of the spread was delicious. The flavours were, might I say, way better than Yeti AND Lama combined as this was authentic Nepalese food for me cooked with care and actual passion.Post that, I even ordered the Veg thali and Chicken meatballs in gravy with rice for dinner. And lo-n-behold they were awesome as well.I'm totally impressed by the joint and shall be a patron, as well as, a promoter.P.S.: The owner is really polite and pays keen attention to what one requests which is seldom seen these days.Go guys! What are you waiting for???If Nepalese food and the other Continental fare (for the not so adventurous folks) are what you seek, this is a wonderful option.Cheers!

One of the best places to munch when you are in safdarjung! Freshly baked buns/breads with amazing variety of food. Nice food  Nice service  Very nice vegetarian burger  And chicken shawarma  Pasta very nice  Weird time food Safdarjung New Delhi  Food 5/5 Service 5/5

Quite impressive for an "after hours" food delivery service. Food arrived on time, was hot on arrival, properly packed and tasted quite good. I had ordered chicken and fries for starters and herbed chicken served with a side of mashed potatoes and grilled veggies. Quantity was more than expected and was good enough for two people. At a 20% discount offer being available at the time the food was definitely value for money.   In terms of improvement their online menu on a different app doesn't feature any drinks option. Choice of nonveg pasta was limited only to chicken lasagna. Didn't see much variety in their main course options beyond chicken and a couple of fish items.  Overall I would definitely like to give this place another try in the near future.

It was my daughter's first birthday and thanks to Bake Studio for making the occasion more beautiful with the prettiest and yummiest Castle cake . It might be a little highly priced than some of the home bakeries but you can rely on this bakery with your eyes closed.

Home bakers are a new concept that‚Äôs picking like crazy, sure we did have our aunts baking for us, when we were kids,  but those were simple cake made in cookers or simple OTG‚Äôs. These days you can get any kind of customization Shape/color/taste, and I feel we should encourage the clan of home bakers in whatever little way we can.  My SIL‚Äôs baby shower was planned last week, since I am new in Gurgaon, my knowledge about places to order cake or anything is very limited. I checked with some bakeries near my place and also few good bakeries in Gurgaon, however I was not very convinced that they would be able to give me what I want, so I requested on FB for someone who could help me with it. And came across Ritika‚Äô s ‚ÄúThe Bake Studio‚Äù. I contacted her and we decided on the design that I had picked up from Pinterest. I don‚Äôt like fondant so we decided to stick to Buttercream frosting and simple vanilla flavor, Ritika suggested we also add blueberry as it will enhance the taste, and true to her suggestion- the cakes taste was elevated.   Ritika herself delivered the cake, we had a little mishap on the way, the cake decided to slip to the side of the box, but Ritika was able to quickly get it repaired:)  The cake was as expected hit and since they were baked freshly it tasted awesome. The sweetness was not perfect, the butter cream was not laden with sugar which I hate. And my SIL loved the cake, we have preserved the fondant shoes in the freezer.   Though the cake was little expensive compared to normal cakes you get, almost 2K/kg (this was 1.5kg), but the smile on my SIL‚Äôs face was worth it.  Thank you ‚Äì ‚ÄúThe Bake Studio‚Äù.
The Bake Studio Cakes are really Delicious and Yummy. Bachhe to Bachhe, Boodhay Bhi Mangay More and More......... and very timely delivered.

Amazing food from Pie , this is a delivery outlet which is delivering food in Saket, Malviya Nagar and Pancheel Park.  Had Chicken Burger, Wraps Veg and Non Veg one with Veggie Delite Pizza.
