And further they haven‚Äôt received the calls in the restaurant. It is not a suitable place for orders in urgent basis, they can cancel the order at any time and they don‚Äôt provide any further service.

It is the best shop in greater kailash for fried and tandoori chicken the taste is very good and the quality and quantity is also very good sitting space is also very good overall I will give 10 out of 10 to the shop
I tried their north indian food sometime back. Tried their Butter Chicken, Paneer Aflatoon, Boti Khurchan and Jhumta Kukkad. The delivery was fast and the food was good. Can definitely try this again

The food used to be good. As was the service. But now, the service is questionable at best, and the food, barely passable. The management seems to have given up. What was once a good restaurant now has servers scratching themselves in front of customers. I leave the rest to your imagination. Another decent place bites the dust!

Extremely slow service and average food. They also tried to place a weird condition on the gold membership saying the second dish (say, a vegetarian dish) would only be free if the first one was veg too!! Matter was resolved only when we called zomato support (and they were really prompt and helpful)

Sitting at the comfort of your home terrace with melodious Sufi music and a drink which suits your personality is how it feels at Cress. Prompt service and consistency in the taste of food is an add on. We ordered drums of heaven, masala corn and dahi ke kebab. I would definitely recommend this place.

Great place to have drinks and chit chat with friends. I was looking to good place like this in India and finally settled to cress Bistro. Drums of heaven is must have dish if you being there. Staff is very great and ready to help you whenever you need. Keep it up guys.

Good cafe food(chilli potato, pizza and pasta), good desserts, angeethis to keep you warm and BYOB to render the angeethis unnecessary. Did I mention it is next door to a theka?  Nights with charming fairy lights makes this place worth a visit!

This was not my first visit to this place, but it was the first time I ordered main course and I wasn‚Äôt disappointed at all!! The Dal Makhani was perfectly cooked. Butter Chicken could have been better but still tasted well with the flavor of garlic naan. I went on a Wednesday and the live music  was a cherry on top.

This place is up to mark with all varieties of pizza and beverages. I was impressed with varieties in menu. This place has no competition when it comes to taste and quality. Took away meat packing jumbo pizza. It has sumptuous and delicious taste. I enjoyed each bite of it. Every ingredients was fresh and hygienic. It was a bit spicy with sauce but I loved it. Packaging was good and eco friendly.  Rates didn't pinch my pocket much. Reasonable rates. I would recommend everyone to try this place. You won't be disappointed.

Jackson height pizza is full of cheeze & fresh vegetables love their topping Stuffed garlic bread stuffing is so good & full on cheez  Packing is very good  Both the dishes delivered hot üëå Must try some more Pizza's & shakes
Their pizza are the best in town. Also Mr. Prajapati whom I have been ordering to has been very helpful in the delivery of hot and fresh pizza, every time I order.

Yesterday I decided to have some very delicious and lipsmacking pizza and ordered from this very good outlet called New York Slice-Express ..had :- brooklyn heights pizza..it was really amazing..full of veggies and cheese..different flavours made me fond of this pizza....affordable rates...Delivered on time.... Recommended

Whenever I crave For some Authentic and Lipsmacking Pizza, New York Slice Express Always hit me up with its varieties of Pizza Last weekend Ordered it from here!  So we har ordered:-¬†  Peri-Peri Pizza:- It was the best at its Taste! A Thin Crust Based Pizza with the Topping of Paneer Tikka, bell peppers and Paprika, topped with Inhouse Peri-Peri Sauces !! Was good to have it  Love for Oreo Being an Infinite! It was Good as well as Refreshing to Drink Loved it!!

Finding Rustom's Cafe & Bakery was bit of a challenge for us today, but as Paulo Coelho says, " And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it". The Cafe is nestled inside KHOJ, International Artists' Association and one will instantly fall in love with the decor and after some time with the food served there.  Thanks for bringing in some quietness and classiness in the world of cafe business‚Äã.
A serene, sound, comfortable place to sit and spend the entire day with great food and teas on the table ‚ù§ Food is amazing mostly because it's prepared and served with so much love and attention.
We have been ordering from this place from few months..the food quality is always good and fresh..the price is also very resonable...Will surely recommend this place for high quality stuff..
I have a sweet tooth. .and keep visit to new place to try out the dessert specially the pastry..This is one of the finest place to have mouth watering pastry ..We highly recommend this place...

Parsi chai ans cheese garlic pao is a must try. I am in love with this place. The place is done neatly and the menu has good options of Tid bits. I called for Chocolate coffee cake in the end it was the best dessert I ever had.  I will surely recommend this place to my friends and family

The food quality of this restaurant has steadily deteriorated. To begin with I was rather delighted at discovering this place. Gradually things went downhill. Sometimes condiments were missing, at others cutlery. Then the food itself started getting worse. I decided it was too much when they sent me chicken manchow soup without salt and with too much pepper. Upon calling and telling them this they sent it again - this time without with hardly any chicken. Had to bin all four soup boxes. What a waste. I'm done with this restaurant. No more chances.
Worst Food Ever. Worst Delivery Ever. Threw the food straight into garbage after it was delivered after 2+ hours.   Don't use this restaurant.

i was in nehru place for a meeting and had already tried various places to eat earlier  which were both expensive and not very tasty food. suddenly I remembered the chinese delivery joint beijing street of vasant kunj. wud they deliver to nehru place. I checked and found they had an outlet in gk2. i didnt order anything to eat during my meeting as I ordered for delivery  nd then had it in my uber ride back home. the veg haka noodles and veg manchurian were wonderful. wish they open in gurgaon also. I have not had such good chinese food for a long time. cheers to their cook and owner. i think they get ingredients from a special place.

My mother had ordered from this place one day. The food was very good. The delivery boy who had delivered it was on time and was very courteous.  Recommended: Fried Chicken Wanton Chilly chicken  Mix meat Rice  Green Thai Curry.  You should definately order and try.

Craving for Chinese then this place is definitely recommended for amazing and spicy Chinese. So we ordered for paneer in schezwan sauce, veg manchurian, corn fried rice, Singapore noodles and veg spring rolls. Everything was yummy and according to my taste. This place is recommended.
Its a good family restaurant and a casual sining place. Its quite crowded most of the times. The preparations are good. loved filter coffee here.

Though you will find this place always crowded and a lot of noise, but the food here is good.  I had veg cheese dosa and filter coffe. To be honest Veg cheese dosa isnt that extraordinary. Sambhar and chutney preparations are authentic.  Paper dosa is something to die for. Medu vada is also seeved hot with hot sambhar.  Good family restaurant but definitely not for couples.

Recently ordered in for the all time favorite masala dosa, along with a rava idli and veg uttapam. So here's the thing, I've stayed in Hyderabad for 2 years, within which I may not have tried the best, but still really nice dosa's and uttapams over there. before I shifted to Hyderabad, the food from sagar Ratna was the best, i mean it's typically the closest south Indian touch that you can get in the northern part of the country. But now that I've had quite a lot of food from there, it isn't as authentic as it should be. But they do try to work alot on it. So hats off. And also a suggestion, please work on the rava idli, as it was not soft enough as it should be. Loveed the masala dosa and veg uttapam. Keep up the good work guys.

This thali has no fault, i tell you. This was my first time at Sagar ratna, i guess and I'm amused. All the dishes were great in it whether it's mixed veg., Paneer or dal. Even naan and lachchaa paratha were so good. Worth a try.

The first thing that hits you is the beautiful ambiance..its like a pretty date..until you realise that it ends there. Even basic chinese stuff is sad. Being from mumbai, we are used to very good chinese. I wanted to play it safe and order from a branded place since I didnt know too many places in delhi. Bad choice. August moon was branded as per the pricing and small quantity, but forget exotic chinese dishes...even basic Chicken Hakka noodles was bad. We ordered 3 of the same dishes...chicken was hardly there...even a roadside joint will serve better quality...this had mostly egg. Really disappointing..and after that the waiter keep hanging on for tips. Price high...just not worth it. Any good reviews here are all by people either known to the owner or digital marketing. I personally visited the place for the food reviewed. Pls just ignore it.
The place feels shabby, the service is mediocre and the food is sub par.  There are so many better options for great chinese food in the area.
Good restaurant ....food is decent not great ..only pro is open air sitting ...their crispy corn and chilli paneer are good ...never try Manchurian too bad ...in all a decent budget place

Bad bad bad. I puked after having there food. And it's not even cheap. Spring rolls stinking of some non edible stuff. Veggies used were like 3-4 days old. I swear I am not exaggerating. I survived. Good luck

The experience of sitting next to a warm coal bowl warming your frozen hands in chilly winters and devouring a plate of prawn dimsums, albeit tiny ones, is unparalleled. Totally lifts up your spirits!  Their soups are yummy too, you have the option to choose from other outlets in the mall so that's an added benefit to visit. Must visit place.
Pathetic taste stale and non tasty food suck!

The restaurant accepted the online order but did not consider it the right thing to deliver the food. They did not even inform us that they will be unable to fulfil the order. We could not call the restaurant as either the phone number listed is invalid or they have turned their phone off. Now we are stranded with no dinner. There cannot possibly be worse service than this. O would have given zero stars but that doesn't seem to be an option.

I have got my today‚Äôs lunch from Country curries, i ordered soya achari chaap, panner tikka, Veg thaali and onion paratha, let me start with achari chaap it was very tasty it was properly cooked i loved it, panner tikka was really soft and juicy, spices were properly used.  veg thaali had almost everything and it was enough for 2 people,  i really liked the packing part, my food was warm when i received it, country curries will be my favourite outlet. Thanks for tasty experience ‚ù§Ô∏è

Country curries is a relaxed dining catering to dishes of North Indian and mughlai origin. People who want sit,relax and enjoy their food specially families,this place is best for them. We tried their bhatti chicken,tawa chicken,afgani chicken and chicken mughlai. The chicken was well marinated in bhatti chicken and was cooked to perfection. Mughlai chicken was rich and aromatic.The curry was smooth and mouth melting. Afgani chicken was creamy and soft and tender. The challatis were thin and crispy. The quality of chicken and ingredients is superior.Each bite gives fresh taste and is delicious. Ample dips and salads are provided along. Highly recommended.

We were craving for some delicious non veg food, and thought of trying from here, it turned out to be the best decision for satisfying our cravings for delicious non veg food. We ordered chicken biryani and kadhai chicken, biryani was so perfectly blended with species and kadhai chicken was finger licking good.

Ordered cold coffee, avocado toast, tomato soup, PAIN au chocolat, and Croque Monsieur sandwich. Boy, oh boy was this bad. The tomato soup was excellent. Very delicious and not spicy which is great. Unfortunately, the croque monsieur was weird and greasy. The ham was wayyy overcooked and the other components just did not go together. Chef needs to reevaluate how to cook that one. Tried to salvage by putting it in the tomato soup but could not eat it. Threw it away it was so bad. Also...pain au chocolat translates to "bread with chocolate". Y'all gave me a croissant. Not even close to the same thing. Avocado toast was replaced with mushroom toast which was also not very good, but at least the restaurant called to let me know. Please pay attention to what you are giving your customers. If one item is not good or it's old, just 86 it. Trust me, you will save WAY more money from 86ing bad foods than from having to do damage control based on bad reviews and a negative reputation. Also, please get a connection with actual French cuisine if you want to get in that business.

Ordered capuccino, pain au chocolate and croissants, first two are barely ok but croissant was more than one day old, completely dried and not eatable at all. Called at restaurant and they close my phone call. Definitely do not buy here.
Best place to enjoy food and time

I love having breakfast before heading for work as i have been getting an hour free in the morning and I particularly love the food from here, the wonder omelette and also the mocha is my favourite combo from here, what a delightful preparation and also so fast the service is, really cannot get any better than this.  A must have for everyone

Coffee bond is one of the most amazing places especially the quality of the food is so excellent and also the preparation of the food is fabulous!! The ambience is so great and my favourite order is the pumpkin pizza along with a cup of cappuccino from here; makes my day indeed

Flat white coffee and also the Monday salad with some many mushrooms sandwich is so yummy from this outlet I would simply love the food from here, the Monday salad is the best from here and also the quality is simply amazing  I would love to recommend this outlet to everyone
I've never visited this place, but I have order 1-2 times & the food was average. Price is very low, so you can order if you are on a budget.
The street cafe is the best place of south ex to order food from. The sandwich it provides is the best thing to have seriously. Nice quality. Feel happy to order the food from here
Shittiest place ever to eat.¬† Close it down, the taste was horrible. The quality was horrible. Literally everything was horrible.
Organo was missing... Pizza crust was also not good..... Not good taste & quality...required lot of improvement. Zomato delivery was well on time.

There is a lot of hard work in packaging and promotions but I was really disappointed when I started eating.  I ordered spinach and corn sandwich and a tikki burger.  First: I received French fries and sandwich   The spinach in the sandwich were bitter and raw. Raw spinach?? Why?  It was the first meal of the day and not really a good start.  Fries were not good too.   May be they should invest more in the chef than marketing.   :)

Well i would start of by saying the place has less and a really congested seating area... The staff is really not pleasant and not ready to listen to the customer's..unable to attend customer's and on top of it the service is too late..they actually need more workers to their place.. The food is served cold ..  Very disappointing.!!

It‚Äôs an awesome place to hangout with friends.We went there for a friend‚Äôs birthday and it was good.We had Gravy Momos-2.5/5 Didn‚Äôt liked it much as there was an essence of coffee which didn‚Äôt go well with the momos. Chilli cheese toast-4/5 It was a great snack. Lemon ice tea-4.5/5 Totally worth it as it was super refreshing and tasted perfect. White sauce paste-4.5/5 The pasta was just perfect! Overall a nice place!

It was a great feeling to see Social in Def Col. But this time I tried different things. They have their own Red Wine and it's super amazing ! I always sticker to their Toxic LIIT but this time I tried their wine and it was awesome... . . . Must try : Social Wine, loaded Nachos, Ramesh Suresh  . . . Food quantity : 3/5 Food quality : 4/5 Value for money : 3/5 Ambience : 4/5  . .
Social is one of my favourite place.  Oreo mud pot shake is my favourite.  Crispy sesame honey chilli crispy fries are perfect. Perfect crisp and serving is very nice Love the ambienceüòç.
Great place, I'm here at least thrice a month. My favs, watermelon meets feta, fish tacos, Sriracha Paneer, Tennessee Wings, pulled tandoori bao's.
Taste was good but little pricey according to me.

Ratna has become a byword for South Indian fast food. A price-friendly option for vegetarians, this chain serves the vegetarian food of Karnataka as opposed to that of¬†Tamil Nadu, which also has idlis and dosas, albeit with subtle differences in the taste. All Sagar Ratna outlets have a high degree of standardization, lightning-fast service and thali meals as well as snacks like idlis, dosas, Uttapams and Upmas. Sagar's affordable Fixed Thali is recommended for those who wish to have a full meal. Otherwise, try the Onion Rava Masala Dosa, the rice-dish-in-a-meal Bisi Bele Huli Anna and the Dahi Vadas, which are all good here. The Defence Colony and The Ashok hotel outlets are the most genteel. For the rest, don't go looking for ambience: This is a strictly functional chain and the prices are proof. Hope you'll enjoy eating food there.

Most of the times when I order masala dosas , they will either send plain dosas with masala separately packed or will send just plain dosas and then you have to wait for another half n hour for them to send the right order .Inspite of being a regular client , they have maintained their reputation in delivering wrong orders .

Ordered for Mysore Rava Dosa and Navratra Idli Chat. All the dishes were really delicious and truly authentic. Perfect place for light lunch.  Ambience is good with good qualtiy and quantity of delicious food.  Idli chat is a must try. The service was really good as well!  Looking forward to more meals at this place!

I receive half dosa And the chatnies are as cold as ice that means they are not fresh. Such a bad experience I not suggest you to pls don't order food form them they are not up to the mark. I give you -100star
Delivery guy was so polite. French fries were so crispy and very nicely packed. Warm and carefully delivered.
Despite requesting for fresh fries and there was no crowd, we got stale and refried French fries !  Sad that they do not care for customer satisfaction
Salad was not fresh alongwith all veggies lettuce leaf paneer waste of money
Ordered ice lemon masala and chilli chicken footlong. The experience was average as the food that I received was a bit cold. I‚Äôve been a regular customer of this place. Will try again though

I think this is the best place to eat out in South Delhi .... The restaurant offers you an extravagant menu to choose from to eat .... Very centrally located and is a very spacious, which allows it to cater a sizable amount of people together.... My favourite is the Butter chicken and it's colour with Butter Naan ... In the coastal section I like the Chettinad chicken being a hard core Non vegetarian ....  The staff is very efficient - courteous and knowledgeable.... The service is prompt despite the rush and the place has a Buzz all the time which makes it a happening place to eat ... Very strongly recommend to visit ....
one of my favourite indian food destination in delhi dal makhani being my utmost favourite here.¬† their sea food is also very popular.
Suffocating, pathetic lettuce salad, vegetarian food very ordinary, waste of money

I loved it here. Especially the ambiance.  Everything I ordered was so delicious especially the dessert. The cheesecake ‚ô•Ô∏è the mocktails the red wine the chicken the pasta the dahi ke choley everything was delicious... a bit spicy but delicious ‚ô•Ô∏è i would love to go again.

The ambience of taksim is great. The indoor seating is pretty decent and outdoor is a good option to sit in a nice weather. We ordered, Palak patta milly filly chaat - It was great. Had also, chutney, masala, curd and fried spinach. Piri Piri flat bread pizza and Cheesy fries.

i have been there last month the food was good but not worth to the price it was bit expensive,ambience was good no doubt in that overall you should visit with your friends good place to hangout üëçüòä

Disappointment! Yes that's actually all Ingot here! While I had heard a lot of good reviews about the place, the furniture is in raters and the food is just about average! Drinks did not have any punch at all!
Ambience was good, initially the music was soft, but on our request DJ played some quirky numbers. Food was good and staff was  also cooperative.

Food:¬† If you are really craving for nice french food this is the place to be. The decor is eye-catching. They keep on updating their menu depending on your reviews. Excellent place for a romantic dinner accompanied by dim lights and classy ambiance.  Drinks:¬† We ordered finger licking Chicken Bruschetta and Chicken Pesto. We reached during happy hours so got 1+1 bear. In cocktail, we ordered this lovely drink called Rositta. Food was nice. Some dishes were really good like Chicken Bruschetta while others average. In the main course we ordered Chicken Breast with morel mushroom sauce which I will say was above average. Overall the food was good.  Service: the service was good. It was as good as it should have been at a place which is having the prices on the higher end.  Music:¬† There was no music but I was glad they didn't try to do it. It helps to have a nice conversation with your partner without all that blaring, unwanted and not of your chosen music.  Value: The prices are on the higher side but the experience is worth it.  Ambiance: The real hero of the story was ambiance. It was at par with most of the restaurants I have been to. when you walk into the restaurant you get a feel of old British colonial era. The classy decor is unmatchable.

BB is a classy fine-dine restaurant with beautiful flavours being served. The ambience is quiet yet elegant coupled with polite staff. Their Pizza had authentic Italian flavour. Watermelon based mock tail was icing on the cake

A favourite of mine in Defence Colony, this chic, French¬†restaurant is a delight in multiple ways.¬†  The gorgeous interiors with floral wallpaper, wooden chairs and tables and a lovely setting in general really make this a wonderful romantic place for a meal. Even with friends and family, this is one of those places where you can enjoy¬†a quiet meal in pleasant surroundings.  The menu and food match the gorgeous ambiance with some truly French and Italian delicacies done so perfectly, you feel you're actually in Europe.  For starters, I've tried their vegetarian quiche which was beyond delicious. Cheesy, soft and fresh, it just melts in your mouth. Definitely, not to be missed.  For the main course, their ricotta and pumpkin ravioli is to die for. Creamy, fresh, delicious...so is their¬†vegetarian lasagna and penne pasta with mushroom and pine nuts.¬† I would also highly recommend their Pizza Verde--with pesto sauce--freshly prepared with pine nuts and rocket leaves. Another favourite of mine, which is no longer on the menu is their stuffed ravioli with figs. I've had nothing like that anywhere else and I'm sad it is no longer there on the menu.  For dessert, their tiramisu is truly divine and has just a hint of rum and coffee without being overwhelming. The cheesecake is soft and creamy and also worth a try. They used to serve creme brulee before they changed the menu and it was one of the best in the city. Too bad it was discontinued.  The place is expensive but worth every penny. I'm waiting for this place to reopen so I can enjoy all my favourite dishes once more!

I was very excited about ordering from Bonne Bouche - their ratings seemed high and the food looked interesting. TERRIBLE IDEA! One, the delivery was 20 mins late. Two, despite being late, the delivery was incomplete. Three, the food was cold. Not room temperature... it was ice cold. Four, I had requested extra sauce and no pepper for my pasta. Instead, I got no salt, and what tasted like undercooked eggy fluid in the name of sauce, premixed with the pasta, rendering it virtually inedible. The side of spicy mushrooms was the only silver in the gloomy grey cloud that my delayed lunch was. Six, it is now 50 mins past my original promised delivery time, and I still haven‚Äôt received my missing ginger ale. I can‚Äôt reach the restaurant - the call automatically gets redirected to Zomato. The restaurant delivery boy called me (he confirmed to me that he works at the restaurant) but refused to connect me to his manager. Horrid, HORRID experience. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The first impression you'll get the moment you enter this restaurant is that it's too proper. The walls have perfectly clean wallpaper, the furniture is almost Victorian, and you're just not used to having so much space to walk inside a restaurant. But if you enjoy that kind of stuff, all power to you. You'll like it here. We parked ourselves on the open terrace. We started off with an almond cappaccino, which unfortunately only sounds innovative. The turmeric and cinnamon cappaccino though was something new.  The preparations, at least the main entr√©es, were truly instaworthy. We'd ordered the Baked Broccoli Tots, pan seared salmon with rissotto and mushrooms, and a vegetarian burger with a falafel patty (I forget the name). These were delicious and filling preparations. I'm not an expert on fish but the people with me that are did appreciate the salmon a lot. And they said its rare to find good salmon, at least in Delhi.  When you see French and Italian on the list of cuisines they serve you can't expect the prices to be modest. But if you're looking for fine food and are willing to shell only a little extra, you'll find that this place doesn't hurt your pocket much.
We order veg platter which was really nice n taste good the quality n quantity were also good. Overall the experience was good as this is one of my fav place in South Delhi

Love the place absolutely. Also, they serve best chilli chicken. Would love to visit again and again. The food and vibe of this place is amazing. The staff is very cooperative. Crowd is fairly good. Highly recommended.
have had there malai and kesariya kulfi at there take away outlet .was malaidaar and delicious rich indian icecream on stick..good quality ..now a regular at there kulfi joint
The best falooda kulfi I have ever had. Moets has set up for kulfi just outside their restaurant. It is amazingly delicious. They even deliver to nearby places and the packing is very good.a

went here with friends quite a good place to hang out and the food sheesha ambience of this place is also so good the people who all are working there was also gud they talk nicely and gently a good place to hang out
Its a most happening place i ever went in weeknd,went with cousins for party. music was awsome,food was nice and ambiance was superb. Highly recommend!

I visited this place on Friday with 3 of my friends the place is spacious and has a nice ambience there is also decent amount of parking space available. The staff was quick and agile. My order was at my table within 15 mins as I told him to get everything together so thumbs up to that. My order was Mac and chesse with bacon, peeparoni pizza, red velvet shake and chesse cake shake. All of them were just average.
Located in nice. Food is good. Staff is a little inattentive which was the only flaw. Overall everything is nice. Good place to hangout with friends.
Amazing food ambience and service..  Tried cold chicken salad , mutton rogan.. the interiors could be better with more ambient lights  The waiters may learn to be a bit more courteous though ..
it is located in south Delhi. it is very spacious.outdoor seating is also available.  food-4/5 service-3.5/5 music-2.5/5 palak pattachaat¬†¬† is a must try.
An amazing restaurant. The food is so good and the place is cosy and comfortable.
Tiniest cockroach in the food - , small cockroach crawling everywhere on the wall , on the table inside the garlic bread basket .. in the bathroom & the best was in my vegetarian food !!

The place has amazing food combos for dine-in that one would love to try. I used to go their all the time with my friends  They are economical and a feast to your stomach. You will enjoy the pizza and the pasta all of it. I would rate this place a 3.75/5 for taste and serving

For drinks we ordered Orange and Kafir Lime along with a classic cold coffee The taste of Kaif Lime was clearly missing and wasn't corrected either. The pizza was thin crust and pretty stand in its taste.  4/5- Ambience 3/5- Food Experience 4/5- Staff and service
Delivery boy is not good. All broken foods.

There was this problem with the hygiene.. firstly i had a hair in my avacado and tomato bruschetta and aftr showing it to the manager he apologised .. 5 minutes later again one hair in my son‚Äôs mexican bowl.. it was so awful and he apologised again and nothing else.. Will not visit or suggest this place again..  rubbish

I went tonight with a friend, expecting to relish some Kashmiri food. Instead I had a terrible experience.  Before I begin, for the sake of every reader who cares about their health and the hygiene of the food and the environment in which they eat food, PLEASE DO NOT GO EAT AT ROAD ROMEO.  We ordered chicken Biryani, dhaniya chicken korma, yakhni gosht, and rumali roti, along with some phirni.  The Biryani arrived first and we were left eating only that. We had to ask multiple times for the remaining dishes to be brought in. The Biryani was your average hyderabadi variety. The korma and yakhni were average as well. While we were eating our food, we noticed a cockroach walking on our table! We called the manager and complained and he moved us to another table. We were shocked and unsettled and asked him to make an adjustment in the bill as a goodwill gesture. Eventually we somehow ate our food, not knowing the condition of the kitchen (while imagining what it might be!) and asked for the phirni. This wasn't fresh at all, as it was completely frozen which is how phirni should never be. I couldn't have more than a bite and returned it.  When the bill arrived I saw that the manager had a refill adjusted 10% and I asked him to consider our bad food experience and extend the discount to a reasonable amount. He started ranting: first he said we usually never offer discounts (to which I replied I usually don't find cockroaches on the same table as my food at top end restaurants), then he started explaining how many times in the year he applies pesticides (!!) inside the restaurant and how the external construction is driving cockroaches to the restaurant. Not once did he try and put himself in the shocked customers' shoes to apologize and insist that a return visit would let us have a far better experience with a completely clean environment. Not once. He continued with his random explanations at which point I'd had enough and had to explain to him what a manager's reaction should be like to retain customers. I should point out that in the whole three hour period there was only one other pair of people sitting having drinks at one end, the whole restaurant was empty. On top of this the manager had no sense in reassuring customers that had just had a terrible experience.   RoadRomeo, first please fire your manager and get someone in there with some business sense who can do a better job for you. Second please ensure you run a hygienic outlet, consider where you are - all outlets in def col are top-end.  I was severely disappointed so am rating this restaurant 1.5/5, will never return.
Brilliant food and decor. Loved the egg biriyani and not very high on the pocket alchohol. The ambience is also nice along with good service.

We all seem to be fascinated by Italian, Lebanese, European, Asian cuisine's of late that we forgot about the enchanting and the divine regional food offered by the heaven on earth Kashmir. When we talk about Indian food we mostly‚Äã segregate that into the North and the South. But if we could just expand our minds we would realize that there's so much more to Indian cuisine than butter chicken, Dal Makhani, Naan, Dosas, Idlis etc. And if you are one such person then you can't give this place a miss.  The only Muddling thing about this place is the name itself - Road Romeo. But with the kind of lip smacking delicacies they offer they can call themselves anything.  Ambience: The restaurant is on the first floor. It's spread horizontally almost like a passage way with Paintings adjourning the walls. You have the glass windows on one end and the bar at the other. But still it doesn't seem congested.  My rating - 4/5  Food: We began with a üêî chicken starter which was good. Since Kashmiri cuisine was almost alien to me I encouraged the elders in our group to pick the mains. So we ordered the Kashmiri Rajma, Lal Paneer and Yakhni Ghost. If I take out my Mom's home cooked rajma out of the race then these were the best rajma I had ever had. Dark red and dense. Spicy yet flavourful. I had them with rice. The Lal Paneer was also amazing. Big cubes of Paneer in a thick tomato gravy. Both the dishes were rich in flavour and I could actually make out the use of hot spices like ginger, fennel, cinnamon, cloves, Kashmiri mirch etc. But the star for me was the Yakhni. I had never tried something like that before. It had mutton pieces in a mild, thin and delicious curry prepared in yoghurt with spices. This was an authentic mouth watering dish. Went well with the Mirchi ka Paranatha and üçö rice.  My rating - 5/5  Service: The service was really good. Very humble and polite staff well versed with the dishes on the menu.  My rating - 4.5/5  Overall rating - 4.5/5 (could have given 5 but would love to see how consistent they are with the food on my next visit)  The appeal - Authentic Kashmiri cuisine. Must try - Yakhni with rice/Mirchi Ka Parantha, Rajma with Rice  My suggestions : None. Everything is on the dot.

Known for their scrumptious mouth watering mutton roganjosh, Road Romeo is not so packed in otherwise crowded def col. if you really enjoy eating and drinking without having to wait to get a table, this is the right place for you. Had a pitcher of bira white. Good place!

In the heart of Defense colony lies this cafe and bar. We expected better from the photos here on zomato but it was all very dull. They have two floors and can be booked for parties. Restro area was nothing fancy just some props on the walls but the service was very slow. We were seating alone but everything took around 20 minutes. Hukkah was not that good. Veg platter was a waste of money. Not very tasty but it was innovative. Chicken wings I think were delicious. Oreo shake was alright nothing great. Honey Chilli Potato were good and crispy. They really need to work on their service and food taste. They have happy hours on drinks. A bit on a higher side of the price limit but it was nothing I would visit again.

You should probably just change your name to Mr. Disgusting.  You don't even deserve the rating - 1. Even a negating number would be embarrassed to be associated with you.  I ordered via zomato and my food took over 2 hours to be delivered and that also an item was missing.  My order was a combo Non veg indian meal and it was cold by the time I received it. The chicken had pieces of charred bone splinters, though on second thoughts I don't think that was a bone splinter, just some gunk that doesn't belong in there. I'm just really scared to even try on the chicken tikka that's a part of the meal.  It's officially the worst money i've ever spent on food. Strike that. It's the worst money I've ever spent.  Also, your food is ridiculously over priced. Slash it down, Mr.  AND get your act together.
Ghatiya..Wahiyat..Pathetic...Its all I can say...Malai Soya Chaap:- A BIG NO! especially if you come from north(Punjab/ Haryana).. AAAAAAA Thooooooo

Inept delivery service. Nearly an hour late; food spilled in the bag and paper bags were wet. Wouldn't order again. And apparently I have to fill up 140 characters to finish this review. So I'll repeat: Wouldn't recommend
You got to try the patiyala chicken!!!the amazingly different taste of the pizzas and pastas..and all this till 3 am in the morning..value for your money ..
Amazing food... I live nearby so the delivery time. Is good. All in all I loved it. Keep up the good work guys!! But yes I want to put forth the delivery time as too good.

So went to this place a month ago.As I was going through the menu I noticed Mutton dak Bunglow the name was interesting so I ordered it .It was a good dish but nobody was able to explain me the reason behind it's name.Rohu Kalia is also a tasty dish which goes surprisingly good with Luchi.I had it delivered and made the luchi at home,you can do the same if you don't want to pay 80 bucks for luchi.
Good ambience.  Tried the egg thali in lunch; comfort food indeed. Dal, jhurjhure bhaja, gobi alu sabzi and 2 eggs in curry. The tomato chatni wasn't sweet

Food: Honestly speaking the food was very tasteless. Begun bhaja was hard, moong dal was so thin and watery, rohu sorshe was also tasteless. The only dish which was good is rohu kalia but it was too spicy. The quantity was very good. Daal, aloo jhuri was sufficient enough for four person. Ambience: Bengali culture themed inside with soft and melodious Bengali signature background music. Service: Friendly and courteous staff. Very helpful.

Being a bengali and visiting a bengali authentic restaurant at New Delhi was a delicious experience!! Located at CR Park this small place is wonderfully decked up for visitors.  Food: for Starters ordered one Basa Fish Fry was crisp and served with kashundi (mustard sauce). Then ordered 3 thali of each Fish, Chicken and Mutton. Each thali was decked up with rice, Aloo Bhaja (slit potato fries), Musur Daal, Aloo Fulkopi and Tometo Chatni! Also ordered Aloo Posto (potato with poppy seeds gravy) and Beguni of peices (bringal fritters). All in this glory of table gala of food we all were full and highly delighted.  P.S check the daal offered may be a little salty which 2 of the tables pointed out!  Price and Service : price was apt with the quality offered on the table and service was also good by the minimum people present to attend the same. The waiter did hear out the salt issue and attended the same.  Ambience was also bengali feel with beautiful painted wall and the Jharbati (Chandelier) hung up.

Found this amazing outlet while hanging out with my friends. . Had amazing dine in experience and tasted droolworthy bengali dishes. . The food was authentic and had great taste, it was pocket friendly and freshly prepared as well. . Some of the dishes we tried: Cholar daal Misti doi Potol posto Chicken kosha Daab chingri . It is a must try for all the food lovers. Highly recommended ü•∞

A famous cutlet shop in CR Park Market 2, serves both veg and non veg cutlets, though I had both of them but I found mocha chop made from lotus flower and onion bhajias really good. Fish cutlet was average though!

Tried these uberly famous Chicken and mutton cutlets (chops) from Dadu‚Äôs cutlet shop which is a very old and popular Bengali eatery in Chittranjan Park, Market 2. Since we are used to having light and fresh cutlets in north india, i found these to be really oily (fried in Mustard oil) with a salty taste in the chicken and mutton. The chutney and salad also did not taste very fresh.

The dalpuri is fantastic. Served with not so spicy alu chole, and at a moderate rate. In evening you can find here the traditional bengali snacks like mochar chop, dimer devil and others. Food for value.
Good Bengali snacks ( chop cutlet) at nominal rates

I ordered 3 Walnut tarts yesterday. There were 2 Walnut tarts and 1 peanut tart. This has happened for the 2nd time. If you are falling short of the order, why do you suppliment it with what you like. Why can't you call me up and find out what I would likeüò°üò°üò°üò°
Red velvet pastry was too bad in taste. Literally vomited  & stomach upset.
I ordered pineapple cake for my father's birthday and it was stale, I would not recommend anyone to order cake from this bakery.  WORST EVER  Spoiling memories
Had Bought Belgian Evasion Cake. The Cake Was Stale. Had Bad Odour Too. Pathetic Experience. Had Registered A Complaint On There Mail No Response Was Received.

These guys have done some amazing job by revamping the entire barren place.  I remember going there and sitting in the open space to enjoy rajma chawal.  A beautiful place to enjoy with you date and great mix of alcohol. They also have love music from Monday to Saturday,  so you can enjoy that.    Food isn't something which is spectacular in fact at times it tastes very kiddish.  The last one I had was palak patta chat,  which was simply a disappointment but galaoti kebab was to die for.

Not too great. Looked interesting from the pics. They don't allow alcohol in the outdoor seating area. They have live music there, which actually is more of a comedy act. That too turns lame after a while. It is also loud to the point where you can't talk to the person sitting next to you. The peanut masala and chilli paneer were the saving grace. Not going there again.

This is legitimately the worst place ever. There are no food pictures because the food never arrived. The service was ludicrous, and so ill behaved. Apparently the coal needs an hour to heat so the pita and hummus couldn't arrive. But it took them forty minutes to inform us that the order couldn't arrive. We asked to see the manager but the server canceled our order. And this place needs an inspection by the health and sanitation department, I don't want so much dhaba vibes that there are lizards on the wall. And what is up with the sad Atif Aslam on loop. Worst place ever, man ! Worst!
One of my most favourite place ! Perfect ambience with great supporting staff. Special shout out to Chandan for his hospitality.  Live music everyday and best sheesha in Delhi!

This place! ‚ù§ As peppy as the name,the place offers both indoor as well as outdoor seating.Though don't get literal,they don't really have a bar as their name suggests.But those curtained seatings n pretty insta worthy setup.will make up for it. Since we weren't much hungry,this is the little menu we went for: Butter Maggi: They had only two types of veg Maggi and since veggies one is too clich√©,we went for Butter Maggi(I know I know, nothing classic there but beggars can't be choosers, right?).Anyway we asked them if they can add some cheese to it and guess what?They really gave us some shredded cheese to go with!! Yayy! The Maggi was scrumptious with bits of onion rings in it and we totally loved it.  Palak patta chaat-Ok,not so great.We have had better at the Chat wala behind Janpath.So it was a layman affair and totally avoidable.  Mojito-Too icy.Nayyy.  But then if you enter this place, you'd definitely leave with a content feeling,that's how the setup is.So ya,I liked.Food can be better though.The staff is nice, pricing is a little on the heavier side.(The cheapskate in me doesn't go for Momos for 250 bucks bruh!) So your call!

Ordered chicken biryani and let me tell you thr portion is ample, the aroma itself gets you hooked, the chicken was so tender , the rice was cooked to perfection and it carried the flavour of the chicken. We also requested for salan along with raita and both were exceptional.   Very biryani lover must order from here. We shall be ordering again.
Great taste with a large variety of food and also with pocket friendly prices, a good place to go out with your mates and family.
Chicken biryani is ultimate!!

Superb option fot delivery for all Biryani Lovers.  Limited Menu with authentic Biryani. I ordered Chicken Biryani which had boneless pieces accompanied by Raita and 1 portion is sufficient for 2 people. Nicely packed and delivery was quick.

Horrendous. Eat here at your own risk. I was shocked to see one of their cooks removing soya chaap from the seekh (skewer) from the tandoor, and then used the same seekh to scrub it on a mouse loitering around his feet. Yuck!!! Enjoy your soya chaap!!

Normally wen we go at the outlet and have it , the food is too good... I ordered soya masala chaap ND Malai chaap it was too lemony.. we cud not eat much and had to throw away.. Even the Malai chaap was lemony. Very disappointed
Its hard to find pure veg in CR PARK & i guess its the only pure veg joint in market no. 2. Tried soya malai tikka & it was too creamy & tastyüòã

I have tried tandoori Chaap.. The best thing for about this place is only that they see serving veg chaap in multiple verity.. I can rate this as per quality 3 out of 5.. But 4 start overall based on taste.

If you ask me in one word to describe the chicken shawarma I ordered at this place, I would say its "bad". Sour minced chicken packed in some boring indian pita style bread and served with some unenticing mayo and mint chutney. Please work on your recipe!
Paneer tikka. Here the beauty is the masala well mixed in the paneer and then grilled which gives a wonderful taste.Well served with green chutney and onions

Sanjha Chulha Is My All Time Favourite Place From The Years Till Now Bcoz They Haven't Compromise With There Quality And Quanity ,I Ordered The Chicken Tikka Masala Roll And Paneer Tikka It Was Full Of Flavours And Spice As Per My Taste From Years ,Though They Have Increased The Price Of Their Food Menu But They Have Same Taste No Nevermind Ordering Again And Again From Here .

The most useless restaurant cum Dhaba of sector 19 . Faridabad . The owner is ill mannered. The delivery of the order takes 2 hours and after that the owner says I can‚Äôt help it . He doesn‚Äôt take calls and if you have guests at they would leave empty stomach . Don‚Äôt order from this useless place .

Nice bengali sweets if you are a sweet lover, loved the chamcham but advice to the management is to reduce the quantity of sugar in it and put less flavor essence in it as it kills the overall taste. At Rs 400 per kg it is a good deal!
Fabulous sweets...specially gur er variants in winter.... Rodhogolla, kachagolla... Price on upperside...
Had rasogollas and langcha. The sweets were cold, and hard, probably made in yesterday taken out from refrigerator. Not satisfied. couldn't finish all the sweets. Wasted.
I love sweets made of milk and I am never disappointed by this place. Very fresh and perfectly sweet. Do visit for authentic Bengali sweets. Fast service and some very very delicious sweets.
Ordered chicken afghani tikka and chicken shawarma. The shawarma was ok but the tikka was amazing. It is a great place if you are looking for good chicken delicacy.

The worst Careless Resturant Ordered Chicken Shawarma Rolls And Given Yhe Instructions For extra Mayonnaise The Resturant Agreed But I Received Order Without Mayonnaise Packet Or Even The Shawarms Were Dry With no Mayonnaise in the rolls.  Greedy Owners Of the Resturant
Tried kadhai chicken from this place. Had a priper punjabi taste with a perfect blend of spices. Really like it. Butter chicken too at this place is amazing.

I placed an order at 7:30pm (700gm boneless chicken breast). For the next hour and a half, the guy at the other end of their phone kept telling me that the delivery guy is on his way. At 9:40pm, a new guy picks up the phone and tells me there‚Äôs no such order with them, and now they won‚Äôt take any order, despite the fact that they‚Äôre still open for the next 50mins. There‚Äôs a reason this place is rated 3.3 here, and I came to know why the hard way ü§¨. Evidently, the management here couldn‚Äôt care less about how shi**y an experience their stores provide (or in this case, don‚Äôt) to their customers.  Kudos guys, for living up to your numbers!!
Very irresponsible. Kept telling that the order is on the way for one and a half hour and post that they said order has not been placed. This is very unprofessional.

This place is managed by God knows who. The rudest staff ever. I have seen the staff engrossed with mobile phone while people are waiting for them to give them their order.  Recently,I was there and one of the old, experienced staff was using cuss words, crude hindi cuss words in front of all the customers which included ladies and a child. I immediately,apprehended him and asked him not to use such words, but he didn't even pay any heed. My card had been swiped else I would have stormed out of the place!  And today, I thought of giving them Another chance, so called in for some home delivery, my order was taken and yet after 2 hrs it wasn't delivered. I called them up, the phone operator was clueless. Then. He did the unthinkable, he put me on hold and went about his business as usual. After 5 mins of holding (remember my guests are waiting in the drawing room) I kept down the phone and have promised to myself that I will never repeat my mistake.

I have been there a quite a number of times. The best thing about this is that taste comes with a pocket friendly price. If you are looking for a good place to hangout under your budget then this is the place. Taste 3/5  Price 4/5 Hygiene 3/5
Great service

This place is not at all worth to visit... Its getting worst day by day....seems like they dont wish to continue with the shop...it used to be good lot of years back...Not at all a good place to visit now..
I recently visit this place. I ordered singapore noodles and spring roll. Noodles was good in taste but I don‚Äôt like their spring roll. It is pocket friendly.  Taste 3/5

hygiene was very bad.....taste was also not so good.....srsly if u r a hygienic person...then u should not try this.....although price are low but taste n quality of food was not at all good...very dissapointed üòî
nice

I have known this place for quite a long time now as it is nearby my place. The food here used to be amazing and tasted so good earlier but now the quality of food has degraded to some other level. Chilly potatoes, spring rolls and fried rice are few items which used to be my personal favourite. Chilly potatoes are now overcooked and not at all crispy like one wants them to be. Also, fried rice are tasteless.  Delivery- As far as their delivery services are concerned, i would say they are pretty good.. you will get your food in time which means your food will be ordered hot which is great but be very specific with whatever you order.

they took ages to deliver. I recieved my order after almost an hour and its at walking distance! moreover the man who picked up the call was very rude. I am not sure I'll be ordering from there again. Very poor service.
When you think about sweets in Delhi first name is enter in your mind is "Bikaner" so yeah I love to visit at this place.. .... best place for everyone

I love bikaner sweets. It is so fresh and tasty. I tried their chocolate truffle pastry it was fresh and too tasty. I will definitely recommend their pastry and sweet. It is affordable with good quality.

Had these tasty bread pakode from this outlet , they were really tasty and oily but enjoyed it ... can't wait to order again ... and rest other items... and me n my friend also tried nearby flavored ice creams ... would visit soon
I am a Fan of Bikanerwala Chains. Its an affordable family place. me and my family like it alot. i tried their sweets . i loved their milk cake , pastry , rasgulla and rasmalai alot. food is yum...

I ordered a briyani and a honey chilli panner. My order was late an hour and didn't receive any notification from the restaurant or the delivery guy. When i called the restaurant the guy told me to take down the delivery guys no. I asked him isn't he supposed to inform me that it running that late? He said the delivery guy had loots of orders and cant call everyone individualy. I then asked him isn't the food gonna be cold he said oh no its not going to be. The delivery guy finally arrived 1hr 15mins later with cold food. They behaved ignorantly and rudely for no particular reason.
No
Food quality and quantity is superb. Decent taste as well.

I ordered BOMBAY BHELPURI & SEV PURI.. and they were awesome!! Really tasty. Though the packaging of one of the items was in a brown paper bag which got a little spilled, but it was okay (not a big deal)
THE TASTE WAS GOOD ..ALSO IT IS ONE OF THE FAMOUS BHELPURI PLACE IN SOUTH DELHI

Although this is a small place with no seating arrangement. But this place attracts a lot of student crowd because of its delicious food. Their Bhel Puri is good. Tried their Veg Cheese Grilled Sandwich and it was delicious. Veg Cheese Pizza was amazing too. They offer really yummy food at affordable prices. I loved it. P.S. their adjoining stall has great kitkat shake.

Pasta la vista is amazing pasta corner they have a variety of Pasta's and Drinks. I ordered mix sauce pasta,there barbeque Grilled sandwiches and Mojito. Mix sauce is very nice it's soo creamy and full of taste, barbeque Grilled sandwiches are also amazing lots of cheese and vegetables they Mojito are quite disappointing they should improve in that
I ordered white sauce pasta from this highly rated place and the pasta was at par with my expectations üòã it was too good üòã it's a must try üòáüòá
Delicious pastas, burger, shakes, pizza and everything else in their menu. The only thing this place requires is sitting. Else everything is perfect and on point
Its a small shop but with a quick and good service. Really liked the white sauce pasta and garlic bread! Will definitely visit again for a quick meal :)
Foods was good . Economically. Good for Friends and families. I tried wrap... . The wrap are a must try ...‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è
Received pieces of hair in my veggie delite salad.
Missed 70% of my instructions.
I love irish coffee from your place its a must have and pocket friendly place too
Tried Cold coffee at this place. I think this was the best cold coffee, perfect taste. The place is fine, the view is good ,but I think it's a bit costly. Overall loved it.
Great staff. Wanted to give a surprise to my betterhalf. Very supportive staff

The ambience of this Costa Cafe outlet is the best. I love my Cappuccino and Brownie always order that. The staff is sweet and always welcome with a smile. When not Cappuccino I love to order Latte or Ice Tea with a Sandwich. Its my one of fav place

This is a great spot for vegetarian food. They have limited seating, and a lot of budget options and combos. The main draw is the quality of everything on the menu, and the hygiene standards. The owner overlooks the food being made, most of the time. You have to try the baked bean wrap, the rice and veg manchurian combo, and the potato cheese burger. They have some good black coffee too. Espresso is cheap, and fresh. This is located just outside the green park metro station, Indian oil exit. Worth it.  Note - it is an eatery, not a restaurant. Don't expect great seating options.

Hello foodies, a small cafe serving some delicious snacks and quick bites. But some time they fail to make the kind of food you love.  Food üî•üî•üî•  Ambiance üî•üî•  Service üî•üî•üî•üî•  Taste üî•üî•üî•  Value for money üí∞üí∞üí∞
A small place to eat just near Green Park metro station. Their burgers are amazing . Reasonable prices . Been here quite a few times and always satisfied with the food.
Place for people looking for authentic Indian food. Good option for vegan people.
I have always liked the cheese biryani here...but this time it was really disappointing...theres no green chutney and onion served with the biryani....this is really bad!

I hax ordered the Paratha dish from here. The food was of good taste along with the paratha they served variety of chutneys along with curd. I enjoyed my meal here in this place it was fun and a good experience having a meal here. I liked the paratha of this place.
Good service.
Expensive place, still haven‚Äôt got my money back even though they cancelled the order
Veg sushis were not that great. Simple decorated with vegies. The interiors and service is worth mentioning. Prettu expensive.

Went here for my two year anniversary and loved the place. The entire ambience is very japanese, and the food is amazing. The staff is extremely professional and courteous. They also don't bother you too much. You can just call them with a bell when you need something. We ordered Asahi beer, which is really good. We also ordered yaki tori chicken, tonkotsu ramen and oh my god sushi. I loved all the food. The sushi was very good quality and creamy. The tonkotsu broth was very well balanced, though I'd have liked if the egg was soaked in soy and only half boiled. But I'm not complaining too much as it is hard to come by decent japanese in Delhi, anyway. Overall, we had a great experience.

Long queue and wait time. Even after a wait time of hours you can‚Äôt expect a better sitting place. Quite disappointed :-( . People go there for the ambience too and doesn‚Äôt expect a table near kitchen where half of the time one get a noise of cutlery and plates .
It was overly spicy! To the extent that I had to throw away the chole masala and chicken kosha!!!! Highly disappointed!!

Today's order of the "marrowlicious" nalli biryani was exceptionally horrible. First, the packaging was bad and the biryani had spilt and some of it had to be wasted. Next the rice was not very well cooked and smelled stale and was extremely salty. Finally, as for the "marrowlicious" part of the biryani that was the biggest scam. I got two extremely short, extremely tiny pieces of bone with hardly any meat on. And to add insult to injury is the pricing of this biryani. In Delhi you can find better biryani, Kolkata or otherwise, at much cheaper prices. And when you do eat the highly priced ones you realise why you are paying such a high price for it, but this biryani is nothing like that. If you like an overpriced biryani which is the epitome of mediocrity then this is your place. Otherwise give this place a big fat PASS!

Ever since I read a post about this hidden gem on @lbbdelhincr , it had stayed on my mind. Finally visited it a couple of weeks back and am delighted & relieved to share that the wait was totally worth it.  Dom Dom Biryani, situated in the by lanes of south of delhi is mainly an order to deliver place with a small dining place for around 4 peeps.  If you are someone who wants to be served more than one type of biryani on the plate, this is definitely the place for you.  We ordered Yorkshire Bacon & Chicken biryani, basically a dum biryani with added goodness of potatoes, chicken, eggs and bacon served with mirchi ka salan. This was the best biryani for me till date and will surely be heading back to try their Kathal (jackfruit) and mutton biryani.  You can order online through the various platforms like zomato, swiggy, foodpanda and ubereats. But if you decide to visit the place, please call the number below as it is difficult to find the place through gps or on your own.  Address : 325 A, South ex part 2. Landmark : Behind south ex part 2 market.  Timing : 10 am - 4 pm & 6 pm - 12 pm (7 days open) Number : 8800886530, 01141086530  Cost of biryani ordered : 550 Rs.  Do order or visit soon as they have a variety of veg and non veg items on the menu but the usp is surely their biryani.

Placed an order of butter chicken with tandoori  butter roti and it was just amazing. The butter chickenwas creamy and buttery with tender and juicy  chicken pieces. The tandoori roti was also paneer andpacked nicely.  good experience overall and would love to give a tryto other dishes
I ordered garlic bread sticks which was just awsome!!
I ordered Sloppy Joe's burger with bacon. The order I received didn't have any bacon in it, or any mayo in it. The tikki was stale. Hot box isn't the same it was. DON'T ORDER.
Pathetic food! The pasta was stale! How can anyone dare to deliver such f uped food!! Don't order people really baf food and hygienic conditions

We ordered the family combo, which included half butter chicken, one dal makhni, 4 butter naan and one zeera rice... It's only 480 bucks... So it's absolutely great if u have to order n share between 3-4 people... The food was packed very efficiently.. And they entertained is even when we called to say we wud need disposable cutlery and they sent it! Taste wise, butter chicken was good.. Dal was tasty, but quite thick.. Naan was really good.. Overall, a good experience! Also, the shwarama is amazing.. With lebanese spices and veggies and sauce and they also serve it with a side of salad!
Stop making fool people. There's big difference between Kathi roll and veg shawarama . U just serving Kathi rolls. Not Arabic shawarama. Paneer was nice
Visited here long time back with one of my friend.  Had Cappuccino and Chicken Sandwich.  Cappuccino was good in taste but like Chicken Sandwich was excellent.
This place has decent interiors and good option in menu. Visited here long time back. Had coffee and Chicken Ham Sandwich which was good in taste but service was quite slow which has disappointed me.
Though they take time in food preparation but i think its worth waiting for. I was not having cash and their card payment machine was not working too, the staff was sweet to corporate.
Delicuous food üòã I ordered sandwich dimsim and tea, absolutely fantastic just loved the staff and food ambience is ok ok but for food 10/10 üòç üòò

This place is descendent to the extremely popular Shoe Garage. Situated in the middle of one of the hippest neighborhoods of the city, this place is extremely popular. The regulars swear by their coffee and savoury snacks.  DECOR: It's done up nicely, with interesting wall frames, simple furniture and colours used in a rather creative way.  WHAT I HAD: I ordered an Americano. I'll surely give a thumbs up for the coffee. It was nicely prepared. To go with that, I ordered a vegetable grilled sandwich. It was above average and nothing extraordinary. The cheese omelette was prepared in a rather interesting way and was definitely my favorite from the lot. I also ordered Maggie but they served me Top ramen instead, which were topped with grilled veggies. They was delicious and so filling.  SERVICE: Although the staff was genuinely sweet and courteous, the service took some time. But I'm not complaining as everything was nicely prepared.  This place is perfect if you want to work in solitude, chill with your buddies or perhaps grab a quick meal. They also play good music.  Kudos to TCG.

I always rated their labanga lotika and chitrakoot as must haves. But last evening the chitrakoot I bought from them was completely spoilt, stale and bad smell. The labanga lotika was way too sweet even for a sweet toothed bengali. Very sad and dissappointing to see their standard deteriorate to this extent. To think of it I travelled all the way from Gurgaon to pick up these sweets only to discover that it was a wasted effort.
Tried various types of sandesh yesterday. If u have a sweet tooth, i'd say anything and everything here is wonderful. Do visit if u r looking for good Bengali sweets.
It's a small shop with very little ventilation, spreading its mishti doi's smell onto all other sweets and the whole closed space. Close your nose and buy rosogolla, everything else is stale.

In the yesteryear's of Treta Yuga even the most puissant, ambitious, intentional and dynamically intelligent mind from the Dravidian society probably faced the issues to consummate maybe because of their southern dark colour with deep eyes and moustaches that he ended up kidnapping or took as hostage the person he liked in the name of "revenge" for his sister, The Ravan. But with Kal Yuga stepping in, the problems faced by the Southerners or Dravidians as to put themselves out there for acceptance by the fair coloured dominance in terms of culture, ethics, opinions, availability and sustainability has completely vanished. Contemporarily Bahubali is crossing crores that Bollywood could ever imagine and Prabhas(the lead) is the new "White" who is much more desired within the bairn.  Luckily for nippers like me the greatest achievement is the act of consenting of their cuisine.  With numerous upcoming waterholes on Peninsular or the island's cuisine, my ship made port at the Peninsular Kitchen, which reflects the greys, the greens and the yellows from Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala , Karnataka and Goa.  Concocted with jute and wooden tables are the amber shimmering artefacts and a menu spanning over 100 dishes covering the specialties of each southern state with some familiars, its bar is definitely not left out from the former.  From Tamil Nadu's repertoire i ordered the renowned chettinad preparation of paneer or cottage cheese. Hot and pungent with freshly ground masala, it did have the fragrance of its own but lacked a mouthful taste and rush of that spiciness. One of the oldest surviving cuisines the Kannada, i called Aloo Gedde a mildly spiced yellow coconut curry with cubes of potatoes worked well with hot Appams.  Though unapologetically my favourite would be another from Tamil Nadu's delights the Chicken Ghee Roast. Succulent pieces of chicken on the bone lathered in a thick, spicy and hot tomato onion gravy cooked and served with a dollop of ghee(clarified butter) will surely give you an insight of gods bhog. And what brings out the richness is a piping hot and an airy egg appam.   Try eating what's trending not only in the food industry also for the yester greatest mind and your favourite Bahubali.
The best to eat üòç from here

Yes my love for your food will follow you BFS......a big thumbs up!!!

Pathetic behaviour   Based on 1+1 offer which is available via zomato gold we have visited the place.  Pathetic behaviour with the customer and denying for the offer.   I request zomato to remove the offer as the owner is not interested.

Cafe Connect is a small tiny yet gorgeous cafe located in Vasant Kunj. It is not located at an easily accessible place or a cafe lane but adjacent to automobile repair shops. The location isn't the best one but the cafe itself looks beautiful from inside as well as outside, so that compensates the location of the cafe. Coming to the interiors, these days almost all cafes are pretty, so what we liked the most is their seating arrangements, absolutely comfortable sofas, on both sides of the tables, the seating areas are divided with translucent glass panels. At first, we were a little not okay with the price to the quantity ratio. They handed us a cafe menu and a restaurant menu, which had multiple cuisine options, but the sizes and the number of pieces of the dishes disappointed us.   We anyways ordered a butter chicken pizza and a chicken malai tikka, and for dessert we ordered red velvet pastry, hoping that they had put cream cheese frosting instead of the normal whipping cream which literally destroys the entire concept of red velvet cake.   Firstly the red in the red velvet comes from beetroot and the cake originally is a chocolate cake, however, in most of the bakeries and cafes, they serve a vanilla cake which is coloured using red food colour. And traditionally the red velvet cake should have cream cheese frosting and not just any white cream on top. The cream here looked pale yellow and we had good hopes since the frosting coloured seemed to be that of cream cheese, and we also asked the waiter, to which he confirmed that it was cream cheese but when it arrived, the moment we dig in our spoon in the pastry we just knew that it was buttercream and not cream cheese frosting. The sponge in the pastry was dry and all in all, it wasn't the best pastry that we tried, also 150 for this pastry is just not worth it.   Coming to the butter chicken pizza, those who follow our blogs must already know that butter chicken pizza is our staple pizza variant of pizza wherever we go. So here too, we ordered butter chicken pizza and they served us an 8-inch pizza which was honestly quite disappointing for the price of the pizza however thankfully they loaded the pizza with a generous amount of butter chicken gravy, mozzarella and about 12 to 14 chunks of tikkas. And we absolutely loved the toppings and the quality of the base which was crunchy yet soft, just the right texture and the toppings were delicious, enlarging the experience of an 8-inch pizza to a 12-inch pizza.   Coming to the Murg malai tikka, if we didn't have access to zomato gold, it would have hurt our pockets hard to pay 279rs for 5 pieces of tikka, but again keeping aside the quantity, they made up for all that by inducing lovely flavours in the tikka. The taste of the tikkas was an absolute bliss.   Overall, they made up for their less quantity by serving quality food, prices are slightly on th3 higher side, red velvet pastry was disappointing, the presentations could have been much much better since the plates they used made the food look sort of roadside presentation with plastic colourful plates. It isn't the biggest concern but for bloggers and vloggers the presentation of food matters for an aesthetic click.   All in all, it was a good experience but the quantity to price ratio is not great.   We would rate it a ‚Öó starts.

I placed an order at 8:20 pm, estd del time 9:45 pm & the food arrived at 11:00 pm. The food arrived cold even tho the restaurant is just 10 mins away. I understand holidays & rush hour but 2 hrs 40 mins is TOO TOO MUCH! Worst is they arrived at a time when we couldn't order again. My old grandmother had to be kept waiting because of their ineptness. And the best they can offer is 'we'll deliver again tomo'. They have no decency or basic courtesy of what to say to disgruntled customers after making them wait so much. DISGUSTING & INCAPABLE SERVICE & STAFF!! Hospitality mgmt is not what it used to be.
